text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Sunday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- U.S. envoy Dennis Ross here in effort to wrap up talks, will push Arafat to close Hebron deal.
- Calls for Israeli President Ezer Weizman to resign over anti-gay slurs.
- Palestinian Authority cool to Netanyahu adviser David Bar-Illan's statehood comments.
- Three held after attack on Israeli army jeep in Golan.
- Ross will demand Arafat sign Hebron agreement, and of Netanyahu -- not to expand the settlements.
- Inter-ministry team drafting programme for stretch of settlement in the Negev, between Gaza and Hebron.
- Dan Meridor in interview says West Bank will receive financial benefits only at expense of something else in budget.
- Government coalition will try to draft a compromise on economy package in finance committee today.
- In Israel the charge is made: Arafat is again trying to delay negotiations.
- Clinton urges Netanyahu, Arafat to finish negotiations.
- Treasury plans tax on petrol and cigarettes.
- Weizman will meet homosexual representatives tomorrow.
